results.title: Gallipoli the Fatal Shore
results.brief_description: This award-winning documentary covers the Gallipoli campaign from both the ANZAC and Turkish perspective’s. Through interviews with ANZAC and Turkish veterans, archival footage and reconstructions, the film creates for the viewer a greater understanding of the tragedy and the complex truth behind the war. It does not glorify war, but rather commemorates the suffering and service of the young soldiers who gave their lives.

results.title: Gallipoli (Captioned)
results.brief_description: A powerful, poignant military drama, “Gallipoli” focuses on the friendship of two young men (Mel Gibson and Mark Lee) in order to personalise the tragedy of the futile World War I Anzac campaign against the Turks. Excellent performance. Technically perfect.

results.title: Gallipoli
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission, Supreme Sound Studios, Frank Hunter, J McGrath and George I. Malcolm
results.brief_description: A recreation of the futile attempt to capture the straits of Bosphorous in 1915 in order to gain control of Constantinople. Shows the needles loss of life, caused by the poor command of Gallipoli, Cape Helles and Suvla Bay. Makes use of documentary footage. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Gallery of the great. No. 1. Churchill
results.brief_description: Profile of Winston Spencer Churchill, from his days in the Spanish forces in Cuba; through to war correspondent; Home Secretary; Mayor during the 1914-18 war; Chancellor of the Ex-Checker; and finally a victorious Prime Minister at the end of WWII. Contains archival footage.

results.title: Gallant Bess
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Harry Rapf and Andrew Marton
results.brief_description: A story of love and loyalty between a young man and his horse until the outbreak of WWII when Tex (Marshall Thompson) joins the Seabees and has to leave his beautiful mare Bess behind. Tragedy strikes when Bess dies giving birth but Tex, stationed on a small Pacific Island, finds new hope and friendship when he becomes acquainted with another horse, one that turns out to be a good-luck charm. Cast includes George Tobias, Clem Bevans, Donald Curtis.

results.title: Galileo: the challenge of reason
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America and Dennis Azzarella
results.brief_description: Examines the life of Galileo, humanist and founder of modern experimental science, who, because of his unorthodox belief, was brought to trial before the Inquisition in 1632. It establishes a contemporary theme in the confrontation between an individual and the Establishment.

results.title: Galerie de portraits
results.brief_description: In ‘Galerie de portraits’, Marie Andre sketches the portraits of five women from among her closest friends and family (including her grandmother and daughter), composing an intimate, intensely private space. Her eloquent compositions focus on the quotidian, the richness inherent in such everyday gestures as watering a plant, lighting a cigarette, stirring a cup of tea. A ‘portrait’ of a woman is drawn from a corner of her room, the objects on her table, or the view onto which she gazes from a window. Andre, master of the subtle romance of the everyday, distils only what is essential — still life’s, nuances, spaces, the rhythm of voices — to obliquely portray the personal essence of the women and convey the intimacy between the artist and her female subjects.
